place.name: LANGRIDGE
place.gazetteerText: LANGRIDGE, a parish, with a village, in Bath district, Somerset; adjacent to Gloucestershire, and near Lansdown Hill, 4 miles NNW of Bath r. station. Post-town, Bath. Acres, 655. Real property, £1,029. Pop., 102. Houses, 19. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Bath and Wells. Value, £111. * Patron, G. W. Blathwayt, Esq. The church measures only 50 feet by 18; has a beautiful Anglo-Norman entrance; and was recently in bad condition. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
